intro: Fimbristylis inaguensis, commonly known as the Inagua flatsedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, spike-like flowers. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Bahamas and other surrounding islands. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
